page.title: 18NOTABLE EVENTS
page.content: The following items of general interest are worth noting:- Sailing on the last ocean going paddle steamer, the Waverley, leave from Penarth pier to Weston in Devon and to Lundy Island. Still on the theme of transport a hundred years of motoring was commemorated when a spectacular parade of vintage cars toured South Glamorgan. People from Dinas Powis walked around the public rights of way in June to ensure they are kept open. St. Cyres Youth Crime Prevention Team are starting a projeect to try to tackle the problem of under age drinking and smoking. They are contacting all the shopkeepers in the area to encourage them not to sell to underage children. Plans have been approved recently to redevelop the site of the Esplanade Hotel, flats, shops and a health club are planned.
